solution_line_template: The first five runners took a combined total of {num_first_group}*{time_first_group} = <<{num_first_group}*{time_first_group}={total_time_first_group}>>{total_time_first_group} hours to finish the race.
The number of runners who finished the race 2 hours later after the first five is {total_runners}-{num_first_group} = <<{total_runners}-{num_first_group}={num_second_group}>>{num_second_group}

The 3 runners who finished the race 2 hours later took a total of {time_first_group}+{extra_time_second_group} =<<{time_first_group}+{extra_time_second_group}={time_second_group}>>{time_second_group} hours to run the race.

Together, the three runners who finished the race in 10 hours took a total of {time_second_group}*{num_second_group} = <<{time_second_group}*{num_second_group}={total_time_second_group}>>{total_time_second_group} hours.
All eight runners took {total_time_second_group}+{total_time_first_group} = 70 hours altogether to finish the race.
